intro: Erigeron lancifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and prairies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are typically white or pale blue. It is an important plant for pollinators and is often used in native plant gardens.
